front.title: Leveraging DNS in Digital Trust: Credential Exchanges and Trust Registries

abstract.t: This memo describes an architecture for digital credential verification and validation using Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs), distributed ledgers, trust registries, and the DNS. This architecture provides a verifier with a simple process by which to cryptographically verify the credential they are being presented with, verify and resolve the issuer of that credential to a domain, and verify that issuer's membership in a trust registry.
